item.title: Three black sacks of bread, 21st August
item.description:
Sacks of bread have been fly tipped by the street bin opposite No69. Foxes have now ripped open the sacks causing littler to be strewn over the field in front of the houses. Clearance and litter picking required.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees and hedges overhanging pavement, 21st August
item.description:
Unkempt hedges and trees on this corner property reducing pavement width considerably and forcing people into the road to pass especially when it has been raining and the bushes are hanging even lower.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highland Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedge overhanging onto pavement, 21st August
item.description:
Trimmed hedges overhanging property boundary by approximately 12 inches therefore reducing width of pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highland Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedge overhanging pavement, 21st August
item.description:
Hedge is overhanging property boundary by approximately 18 inches in places. Although the property owner trims the very high hedge they do not take it back to the property boundary. Therefore part of the pavement is lost for the whole width of the property.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Silver lexus, 21st August
item.description:
Reg CCM 776 dumped window open
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paint everywhere, 21st August
item.description:
This explosion of paint has been in the community recreational park for weeks and has been ignored. I marked it as offensive, I’m offended the council is lazy and can’t do their job. It shouldnt need to be logged in fix my street, there’s zero excuse why it hasn’t been dealt with.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Edmond rd and Hazelmere rd, 21st August
item.description:
If I was blind I would 100% trip over these bikes just left in the middle of the pavement. Completely unacceptable.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glengall Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kenilworth Road, 21st August
item.description:
Please please please sweep the street. It is never ever swept. It is left all year round but come on, you have to sweep the streets. Is that not a thing anymore?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kenilworth Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Slides, 21st August
item.description:
The slides aren’t slippery anymore. This has twice caused my child’s shoe to grip on the slide surface and fling her forward causing her to bash her head. They need cleaning and polishing. They don’t even slide if you lift your feet completely off the slide surface. This is the case for every slide in the playground. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Falconwood Parade, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pile of pine needle debris, weeds needs removing, 21st August
item.description:
Most of this pile has been cleared from under the adjacent seat, adjacent to the triangular beds and rockery. Please can it be removed. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kelsey Park Avenue, Beckenham, London

item.title: Glenview Upper Abbey Wood - Pot Holes, 21st August
item.description:
The complete road running some four hundred metres needs resurfacing. It still has some surface material dating from the nineteen fifties. Yet ? A fresh layer it required again..
Report on FixMyStreet
